meanings.definition: The act or instance of revolting against an established authority or government.
meanings.sent1: The insurgencies in the region caused chaos and unrest.
meanings.sent2: The government worked hard to suppress the insurgencies threatening its power.
meanings.sent3: The insurgencies decided to throw a surprise party for the authorities.
meanings.sent4: Her rebellious spirit was like a wildfire, sparking insurgencies wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The image of the insurgents marching in the streets will forever be linked to insurgencies.

meanings.definition: A group of people engaged in such activities.
meanings.sent1: The insurgencies were well-organized and determined to overthrow the government.
meanings.sent2: The authorities were on high alert, monitoring the movements of the insurgencies.
meanings.sent3: The insurgencies formed a book club to discuss their plans for rebellion.
meanings.sent4: The tight-knit group of insurgents operated like a well-oiled machine, carrying out insurgencies with precision.
meanings.sent5: The leader of the insurgencies inspired loyalty and dedication among the members.
